'''Fara Með Vikingum''' is an Icelandic song ("To go with the Vikings") by the 10th century poet [[Wikipedia:Egill Skallagrímsson|Egill Skallagrímsson]]. It is published as the second song in ''[[Songs for the Philologists]]'' in [[1936]].

==The song==
<poem style="font-style:italic; margin-left:20px;">
'''Fara Með Vikingum'''

Þat mælti min moðir,
at mer skyldi kaupa
fley ok fagrar arar,
fara! a brott með vikingum,
standa upp i stafni,
styra clyrum knerri,
halda sva til hafnar,
hoggva mann ok annan.

Drekkum or, þo at Ekkils
eykriðr beri tiðum
hornasund at hendi,
hvert full, bragar Ulli.
leifi ek vætr, þo at laufa
leikstærir mer tæri
hrostatjorn i horni,
horns, til dags at morni <ref group=note>This is the ''exact'' form as is printed in the ''Songs''.</ref>
</poem>

{{notes}}
